ราคา Solana ใกล้ 90 ดอลลาร์ แต่ผู้ซื้อระยะยาวยังคงสะสม

Solana Price Near $90, but Long-Term Buyers Are Still Accumulating

1d ago//Aaryamann Shrivastava
altcoins
AI

Summary

TH

Solana กำลังซื้อขายใกล้ระดับ $90 โดยตัวชี้วัดบนเชนบ่งชี้ว่าราคาอยู่ในภาวะต่ำกว่าคุณค่าและอาจใกล้ถึงจุดพื้นตลาด อัตราส่วน MVRV ได้ลดลงสู่ระดับ 0.65 ซึ่งเป็นระดับที่พบได้ในช่วงลงท้ายของการปรับตัว สะท้อนให้เห็นว่าผู้ถืออยู่ในภาวะขาดทุนแต่ยังคงถือครองโดยไม่มีการขายแพงขายถูก แม้จะมีแรงกดดันในการขายออก แต่ผู้ซื้อระยะยาวยังคงสะสม Solana ต่อเนื่อง ซึ่งแสดงให้เห็นถึงความมั่นใจแม้ราคาจะผันผวน เพื่อยืนยันแนวโน้มขาขึ้นและมุ่งสู่เป้าหมาย $156 ราคาจำเป็นต้องกลับคืนไปเหนือ $104 ในขณะที่การหลุดต่ำกว่า $83 จะส่งผลให้มุมมองเชิงบวกเป็นโมฆะ

EN

Solana is currently trading near $90, with on-chain metrics suggesting it is significantly undervalued and potentially nearing a market bottom. The Market Value to Realized Value (MVRV) ratio has dropped to 0.65, a level historically associated with late-stage corrections, indicating that holders are underwater but persistent rather than capitulating. Despite recent distribution pressure, long-term buyers continue to accumulate tokens, absorbing selling pressure with resilience. To confirm a bullish reversal and target the $156 region, SOL needs to reclaim $104 as support; however, a decisive drop below $83 would invalidate this outlook and signal further downside.

Key Points

  • Solana's MVRV ratio of 0.65 suggests deep undervaluation and a potential market bottom.
  • Long-term holders have accumulated approximately 5 million SOL, showing resilience despite recent losses.
  • A break above $104 is needed to target $156, while falling below $83 would invalidate the bullish thesis.

Article

Solana trades near $90 as undervaluation signals potential market bottom. Holder accumulation persists despite losses, supporting long term bullish structure. Break above $104 needed to target $156, loss of $83 invalidates outlook. Solana remains under sustained distribution pressure following a sharp sell-off, with price carving out a descending wedge on the daily timeframe. This structure closely resembles a setup seen in the prior cycle that preceded a meaningful upside expansion. Beyond technical symmetry, on-chain valuation metrics are also signaling that SOL may be entering a basing phase as downside momentum continues to decelerate. Sponsored Sponsored Solana Holders Are Still Bullish Solana’s Market Value to Realized Value (MVRV) ratio is currently reading 0.65, placing SOL in undervaluation territory. This is the lowest level recorded since September 2023 and represents a near two-and-a-half-year extreme. An MVRV below one implies that the majority of holders are underwater, a condition that often coincides with late-stage corrections rather than the start of fresh impulsive sell-offs. Historically, prolonged compression at these levels has reduced sell-side urgency. As unrealized losses dominate, participants tend to shift from distribution to patience, waiting for mean reversion. This environment frequently precedes stabilization phases, even if the price remains volatile in the short term. Want more token insights like this? Sign up for Editor Harsh Notariya’s Daily Crypto Newsletter here . Solana MVRV Ratio. Source: Glassnode Despite the drawdown, holder behavior continues to reflect resilience rather than capitulation. Notably, Solana’s realized price remains above spot price, a configuration that has historically aligned with macro bottoms. The same structure was observed in March 2025, when SOL transitioned into accumulation before initiating a recovery phase. Sponsored Sponsored That period was characterized by rotation, not panic-driven selling. Current flows suggest a similar pattern is developing. From December 2025 to the present, investors have accumulated approximately 5 million SOL, valued at $455 million. This steady absorption during weakness points to sustained conviction among larger participants. Historically, consistent accumulation during corrective phases has supported Solana’s medium-term trend reversals. Solana Realized Price and Exchange Balance. Source: Glassnode SOL Price Aims At Long-Term Breakout SOL is currently trading near $90, approaching the lower boundary of its descending wedge—a critical decision zone. A comparable setup in early 2025 saw price defend this region before breaking higher, ultimately delivering a 43% expansion. Current price behavior is structurally consistent with the early stages of that move. The existing wedge projects a potential 31% upside, targeting the $156 region. However, confirmation remains conditional. Price must first bounce and reclaim $104 as support to validate bullish continuation. Acceptance above $122 would confirm a breakout and align price action with improving macro and on-chain signals. Solana Price Analysis. Source: TradingView That said, downside risk cannot be ignored. If accumulation weakens or reverses, SOL risks losing $83. A decisive break below this level would expose $75 or lower and invalidate the bullish thesis, confirming continuation of the broader corrective trend.
